intro: Synnema brevitubum, commonly known as the short-stemmed synnema, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, woolly leaves and clusters of pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along streams. Synnema brevitubum is often used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
